answers.text:
Hi Amal, 
In addition to the great resources provided by Pam we have a few other resources worth checking out on the Knowledge Network. 
The City of Westminister, CO has posted their strategic succession management program which was an ICMA strategic leadership and governance award nominee. http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/303437/Strategic_Succession_Management_Program
This is a group of multiple case studies on the topics of employee attraction and retention, succession planning, and leadership and workforce development. http://icma.org/en/icma/career_network/career_resources/news_reports_presentations/preparing_cases
I hope you find these resources useful as you create your own succession planning policy. 
Best, 
Robin Saywitz 
ICMA Knowledge Network Intern 
rsaywitz@icma.org

author: Amal Popatia
text:
Good afternoon,
I am researching succession management best practice and I was wondering if you have anything from your organization to share on the following: 

Ideas for developing high potentials?
What kind of rating systems are used?
Do you assess people OR positions OR both?
Examples on actual succession management frameworks, processes
How often to you evaluate positions or high potentials?
What role does the Leadership Team play in this process?
Do you have a talent pool? If so, how is this managed? By who? 

Any feedback would be greatly appreciated by Tuesday, December 17th.
Please contact me if you have any questions.
Regards,
title: Succession Management Framework
